name: Arnica montana
description: Used topically or orally by homeopaths after bruising or blunt trauma; marketed for relief from soreness—use conventional care for significant injury.

name: Aconitum napellus
duration: Single dose then every 1-2 hours for 6 doses
description: Often used in homeopathy for sudden onset fever or acute anxiety after shock; short-term dosing typical in acute presentations.

name: Belladonna
description: Commonly used in acute, high-fever states with flushing in homeopathic practice; avoid replacing urgent medical assessment.

name: Bryonia alba
description: Used by homeopaths for pain aggravated by movement and dry painful coughs; described as ‘worse on motion’ in homeopathic materia medica.

name: Chamomilla 30C
description: Frequently recommended for irritable, inconsolable children and teething discomfort in homeopathic practice.

name: Nux vomica
description: Used for digestive upset related to overindulgence, nausea, or sensitivity to stimulants in homeopathic prescribing.

name: Pulsatilla nigricans
description: Used for changing, mild respiratory complaints and emotional tearfulness; considered a ‘soft, changeable’ symptom profile in homeopathy.

name: Rhus toxicodendron
description: Often used for stiffness relieved by continued motion (homeopathic rubric), e.g., sprains or stiff joints.

name: Sepia officinalis
description: Commonly used in chronic female complaints like menstrual disturbances and hormonal mood changes in homeopathic practice.

name: Ignatia amara
duration: 1 dose then PRN for several days
description: Used for acute grief, emotional shock and mood swings according to homeopathic tradition.

name: Apis mellifica
description: Selected in homeopathy for stinging-type swelling, hives and edema with heat and redness.

name: Ledum palustre
description: Used in homeopathy for puncture wounds, insect bites and to prevent or treat local swelling.

name: Arsenicum album
duration: 1 dose then every 2-4 hours for acute GI distress
description: Used for acute gastroenteritis with restlessness in homeopathic practice; emphasizes chilliness and anxiety in symptom picture.

name: Calcarea carbonica
description: A common constitutional remedy in homeopathy for sluggishness, growth and metabolic stereotypes—used in chronic prescribing frameworks.

name: Silicea (Silica)
description: Used in homeopathy for chronic low-energy states, skin and nail complaints and to assist expulsion of foreign bodies.

name: Sulphur
description: Widely used constitutional remedy for chronic skin, burning sensations and general ‘warm-bloodedness’ in homeopathic practice.

name: Lycopodium clavatum
description: Employed in chronic digestive complaints with bloating and in certain personality rubrics in homeopathy.

name: Graphites
description: Selected for chronic skin conditions, fissures and thickened secretions by homeopaths.

name: Hepar sulphuris calcareum
description: Used where infections are thought to have pus formation or where sensitiveness to touch is described in homeopathic practice.

name: Mercurius solubilis
description: Used in homeopathy for mouth/throat infections with salivation and sensitive glands—closely monitored due to historical mercury source (homeopathic dilutions claimed inactive).

name: Phosphorus
description: Used by homeopaths for bleeding tendencies, respiratory weakness and marked sensitivity to stimuli.

name: Natrum muriaticum
description: Common constitutional remedy for grief, emotional withdrawal and salt-craving types in homeopathy.

name: Kali bichromicum
description: Used for thick, stringy respiratory secretions (sinusitis/bronchial complaints) in homeopathic teaching.

name: Kali muriaticum
description: Used for catarrhal conditions with bland mucus in homeopathic practice.

name: Staphysagria
description: Used for suppressed emotions and after surgical/incision trauma according to homeopathic rubrics.

name: Thuja occidentalis
description: Often used in homeopathy for wart-like growths, post-vaccination complaints and certain chronic patterns.

name: Silicea 6X
description: Lower potency form used for chronic weakness, drainage and slow-healing wounds in homeopathic practice.

name: Ferrum phosphoricum
category: Used by homeopaths in early-stage fevers and inflammations; marketed as gentle support in early illness.

name: Carbo vegetabilis
category: Used in homeopathy for weakness, collapse tendencies and severe bloating with belching.

name: Hypericum perforatum
category: Used in homeopathy for sharp, shooting nerve pains, puncture wounds and injuries involving nerves.

name: Calendula officinalis
category: Used topically for wound care and orally in homeopathic form for tissue repair—widely sold in OTC wound products.

name: Bellis perennis
category: Selected for deep tissue bruising and muscle soreness in homeopathic materia medica.

name: Arnica topical ointment
category: Topical arnica products marketed for bruising and soreness; note topical formulations are not the same as ultra-dilute homeopathic globules.

name: Ledum topical
category: Topical Ledum preparations sold for puncture wounds and insect bites.

name: Mercurius solubilis 200C
description: High-potency homeopathic remedies used by some practitioners for deep-acting constitutional work—often practitioner-guided and controversial.

name: Homeopathic Nosode (various)
description: Prepared from disease material in homeopathy and used in some alternative schedules—controversial and not a substitute for vaccination.

name: Sulphuricum acidum
description: Used for chronic mucosal complaints and acidic conditions in homeopathic practice.

name: Anacardium orientale
description: Used in homeopathy for mixed mental states, self-doubt and memory complaints in certain rubrics.

name: Natrum sulphuricum
description: Used by homeopaths for post-head injury/viral sequelae and certain headache types.
